history.content: Applying before knowing your grade is completely normal. The CS department will see your official grade when it's formalized on your transcript and admit you to the major. You don't need to update it and haven't messed up.

So I submitted my petition to declare CS in November, before I finished 61B. Thus, I submitted the Fall 2019 form. I finished all my prerequisites with a 3.9 average. Did I do all the steps correctly? I'm afraid I messed up somewhere and won't be able to declare this semester.

I checked my form again today and on the top it said "Note: you already submitted an application... for Fall 2019." It didn't have my 61B grade in, so I just added it.

Does everything seem ok?
history.subject: Submitting major declaration form
